message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The characteristics of the mass suggest a fibroadenoma, which is the most common benign breast tumor in young women. DCIS and inflammatory carcinoma are more aggressive types of breast cancer and Phyllodes tumor is a rare type of tumor that is usually larger and has more irregular margins.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The characteristics of the mass, including its size, mobility, and well-defined margins, are consistent with a fibroadenoma. DCIS would have calcifications on mammography, and phyllodes tumor and inflammatory carcinoma typically have more irregular borders and can involve lymph nodes. The tenderness reported by the patient is also more common with fibroadenomas.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The characteristics of the mass - firm, mobile, well-defined margins, occasional tenderness - suggest that it is a Fibroadenoma. DCIS would have shown calcifications on mammography, Phyllodes tumor would have larger and more irregular margins, and Inflammatory carcinoma would have involved lymph nodes.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Based on the description, the most likely cause is fibroadenoma, a benign breast mass commonly found in young women. DCIS and inflammatory carcinoma are malignant while Phyllodes tumor is rare and usually presents with a larger mass.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The characteristics of the mass, such as its mobility, well-defined margins, and occasional tenderness, suggest that it is a benign lesion. Among the options, fibroadenoma is the most common benign breast tumor in young women and is consistent with the characteristics of the mass. DCIS and inflammatory carcinoma are more likely to have lymphatic involvement, while phyllodes tumor is rare and tends to be larger than 4 cm.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The characteristics of the mass (firm, mobile, well-defined margins) and the fact that mammography showed a dense lesion suggest that the most likely cause is a fibroadenoma. DCIS would show microcalcifications on mammography and may have lymph node involvement. Phyllodes tumor is not as common and would present with a rapidly growing mass. Inflammatory carcinoma would present with breast swelling, redness, warmth, and pain.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Fibroadenoma is the most common benign breast mass in young women and is usually well-defined, firm, and mobile with no lymphatic involvement. DCIS, phyllodes tumor, and inflammatory carcinoma are less likely given the characteristics described in the question.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is young and the mass has well-defined margins, suggesting a benign tumor. Fibroadenoma is the most common benign tumor in young women and can cause occasional tenderness. The lack of lymphatic involvement also supports a benign diagnosis, ruling out DCIS and inflammatory carcinoma. Phyllodes tumor is rare and usually presents as a rapidly growing mass with a leaf-like shape.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The described characteristics of the mass, including mobility, well-defined margins, occasional tenderness, and lack of lymphatic involvement, suggest a fibroadenoma. Ductal carcinoma in situ and phyllodes tumor would likely have irregular margins and potentially involve lymph nodes. Inflammatory carcinoma would present with erythema and warmth, which are not described in the scenario.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The characteristics of the mass, including being firm, mobile, and having well-defined margins, are consistent with a fibroadenoma. DCIS usually presents as calcifications on mammography, and Phyllodes tumors are more commonly found in older age groups. Inflammatory carcinoma usually has lymphatic involvement and presents with signs of inflammation such as redness and warmth.
